thread.title: Agatha Christie's hotel in Syria 'used as military barracks by Assad regime'
thread.title_full: Agatha Christie's hotel in Syria 'used as military barracks by Assad regime'

author: Lizzie Porter
title: Agatha Christie's hotel in Syria 'used as military barracks by Assad regime'
text: Syria Agatha Christie’s hotel in Syria ‘used as military barracks by Assad regime’ The Syrian hotel in which Agatha Christie wrote Murder on the Orient Express is reportedly being used as a military barracks by Assad regime soldiers The Baron Hotel once accommodated politicians and high-profile writers including Freya Stark and Charles de Gaulle, but is now reportedly occupied by Assad soldiers Photo: Alamy
